name: Job
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google BigQuery.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigquery = gcloud.bigquery();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigquery = gcloud.bigquery({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Job
methods.description:
Job objects are returned from various places in the BigQuery API:

  • bigquery#getJobs
  • bigquery#job
  • bigquery#query
  • bigquery#startJob
  • bigquery/table#copy
  • bigquery/table#createWriteStream
  • bigquery/table#export
  • bigquery/table#import

They can be used to check the status of a running job or fetching the results of a previously-executed one.

examples.caption: All jobs are event emitters. The status of each job is polled continuously, starting only after you register a "complete" listener.
Be sure to register an error handler as well to catch any issues which impeded the job.
To force the Job object to stop polling for updates, simply remove any "complete" listeners you've registered. The easiest way to do this is with removeAllListeners().

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description: Get the metadata of the job. This will mostly be useful for checking the status of a previously-run job.

examples.code:
var job = bigquery.job('id');
job.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Cancel a job. Use bigquery/job#getMetadata to see if the cancel completes successfully. See an example implementation below.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: Get all of the results of a query.
Customize the results you want to fetch.
To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Consume the results from the query as a readable object stream.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • Page token, returned by a previous call, to request the next page of results. Note: This is automatically added to the nextQuery argument of your callback.

params.name: options.timeoutMs
params.description: • How long to wait for the query to complete, in milliseconds, before returning. Default is to return immediately. If the timeout passes before the job completes, the request will fail with a TIMEOUT error.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function. If you intend to continuously run this query until all results are in as part of a stream, do not pass a callback.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.
